ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.test

Class StoryListControllerTestCases

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • android.test.InstrumentationTestCase
          • android.test.ActivityTestCase
            • android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2<MainActivity>
              • ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.test.StoryListControllerTestCases
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class StoryListControllerTestCases
extends android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2<MainActivity>
    These test cases test that the StoryList controller behave to meet the needed requirements. Function that will be tested are: addStory, setStory, and createBlankStory(). The storyList controller is made of getteres and setteres that control all variables From the storyList.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StoryListControllerTestCases() 
      StoryListControllerTestCases(java.lang.Class<MainActivity> activityClass) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testAddStoriesToList()
      tests if new stories can be added to the story list with the addStory function
      void testAddStory()
      Creates a new story to the story list
      void testCreateBlankStory()
      Tests whether a blank story (story with no parameters) can be made
      void testGetInitialListOfStories()
      test if the initialized screen with no stories does in fact return no stories
      void testGetStoryAtPos()
      tests the getStoryAtPos function which should return a certain story from a specific position in the storylist
      void testGetStoryWithObject()
      tests the getStoryAtPos function to test if story details can be retrieved
      void testGetStoryWithTitle()
      tests the getTitle function, to see if a title is received
      void testSetStory()
      tests to see whether a story set in a new position takes its place in the story list
      void testSetStory2()
      tests if by using the setStory function, more stories can be added to the storylist
      void testSetUp()
